poem:
### Octopus Sky

Steel tendrils weave,  
rooted in the air's expanse;  
silent sentinels  
guard the breath of  
land etched deep  
in their manufacture.  
In a choir of surveillance,  
they rise,  
dancing against shadows,  
a hymn of resilience,  
whispering through the  
veins of clouded storms.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The first three manufacturers had begun production and 11 more were preparing to set up production lines, the defence ministry said on Friday. The drones would be based on a domestically developed technology called “Octopus” to intercept Shahed drones. It had been tested in combat and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
